item.title: Expert en Coopération Décentralisée (Senior)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
L’étude aura pour objectif général de compléter la capitalisation des expériences et les analyses concernant la coopération décentralisée.

Project duration: 6 months

Expert en Coopération Décentralisée (Senior)

  • Master ou expérience équivalente de travail dans la politique/Relations Internationales /Coopération au Développement /Affaires de l’UE/Sociologie.

  • Anglais français et espagnol courants, à l’écrit et à l’oral.

  • Minimum 10 ans d’expérience professionnelle en coopération pour le développement, dont 5 ans dans le domaine de la Coopération Décentralisée.

  • Bonne connaissance et compréhension des règles et procédures concernant l’implication des Autorités locales dans la coopération de l’UE via la coopération décentralisée.

  • Une expérience probante au sein de la Commission Européenne, et en particulier au sein d’une Délégation de l’UE, présenterait un avantage certain.

  • Expérience dans les études d’analyse voire d’évaluation, avec des méthodologies spécifiques et des techniques d’enquête, et des antécédents en matière de production de résultats selon des standards professionnels.

  • Une expérience préalable dans les analyses et les études de cas sur les Autorités locales présenterait un avantage certain.

  • Excellentes compétences d’analyse et de rédaction ; expérience dans la production de matériels écrits. • Bonnes compétences en matière de communication, capacité à conduire des entretiens, y compris à niveau ministériel. • Compétences informatiques confirmées.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to agnese_ortolani@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert en Procédures de l'UE
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
OBJECTIF GLOBAL

L'objectif général du présent marché est l’élaboration d'un nouveau programme d'appui au développement du secteur privé tunisien pour financement dès 2015.

OBJECTIFS SPECIFIQUES

Sur la base des recommandations issues à la fin de la phase d'identification, formuler un nouveau programme d'appui au développement du secteur privé tunisien, afin de faciliter le lancement de sa mise en oeuvre dans les meilleurs délais après la signature de la convention de financement.

Expert en procédures de l'UE

Education :

  • Diplôme de l’enseignement supérieur (minimum Bac +3) en gestion, économie, droit, relations internationales ou équivalent, ou expérience professionnelle équivalente (10 ans minimum).

Expérience professionnelle générale:

  • Expérience confirmée d'au moins 6 ans dans le domaine de la coopération au développement.
  • Expérience en Tunisie, serait considérée comme un atout.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique :

Excellente maîtrise des procédures européennes dans le cadre des actions extérieures, documentée par une expérience dans un ou plusieurs des domaines suivants :

  • Preparation de Fiches d'Action;
  • Préparation de Conventions de financement, y compris les Disposition Techniques et Administratives (CTA) et le cadre logique ;
  • Préparation de dossiers d’appel d’offres (DAO) pour les marchés de services ;
  • Préparation de fiches de jumelage ;
  • Préparation de lignes directrices pour des appels à proposition.

Preparation de Devis Programmes.

Compétences en langues et informatique:

  • Excellente maîtrise de la langue française écrite et orale ;
  • Excellente maîtrise des outils informatiques (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Agnese_Ortolani@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: M&E Adviser, Labour Mobility Initiative
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Since 2009 Australia has funded Pacific island governments under the Labour Mobility Initiative (LMI) to recruit, prepare and manage workers for job placements in the Pilot Seasonal Worker Pilot Scheme (PSWPS) and then the Seasonal Worker Program (SWP).

In September 2013, a design mission was undertaken to develop a new phase of the LMI with a focus on improving the capacity of participating governments to recruit, prepare and manage workers for the SWP and to assess new options for capacity development and delivery. Any capacity building assistance would continue to focus on Pacific island governments as managers of the recruitment process.

The new LMI aims to improve the capacity of participating governments to manage aspects of the SWP. There are nine participating countries in the SWP – Solomon Islands, Vanuatu, Papua New Guinea, Kiribati, Tuvalu, Nauru, Samoa, Tonga and Timor-Leste.

The overall goal of the LMI is to address poverty through increasing incomes, improving human capital and maximising the use of earnings from labour mobility for women and men in the region. At the conclusion of the LMI, there are expected to be four primary outcomes:

  • Increased numbers of workers from participating countries take up seasonal work opportunities
  • Communities benefiting from the effective use of remittances earned through labour mobility
  • Women and men participating in the seasonal worker program have increased employability
  • Increased partner government capacity to manage international labour

The M&E Adviser will have overall responsibility for effective monitoring and evaluation of the LMI, as well as delivering capacity building and training to staff of partner governments responsible for M&E of labour mobility programs. These services will be delivered to best-practice standards, in accordance with the requirements and terms of the contract.

Mandatory competencies and experience

  • Extensive experience working in developing countries.
  • Proven capacity to build and maintain effective relationships with senior personnel in government and donor agencies.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of contemporary monitoring, evaluation, learning and reporting policies, and the development of M&E systems and frameworks.
  • Proven ability to transfer knowledge and understanding associated with M&E systems and procedures to developing country counterparts.
  • An understanding of the social, cultural, political and institutional factors affecting development in the Pacific and Timor-Leste.
  • Strong analytical skills, strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills in English.

Desirable competencies and experience

  • Tertiary qualification in a relevant field.
  • Experience in the design and delivery of M&E systems for capacity building programs in the Pacific and Timor-Leste.
  • Experience with Australian aid program processes and procedures.

The M&E Adviser may have up to 240 days of inputs across the total Program (both the initial term and Option to Extend term, in the event that the Option to Extend was enacted).

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting LMI/M&E in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

item.title: Capacity Building Adviser, Labour Mobility Initiative
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Since 2009 Australia has funded Pacific island governments under the Labour Mobility Initiative (LMI) to recruit, prepare and manage workers for job placements in the Pilot Seasonal Worker Pilot Scheme (PSWPS) and then the Seasonal Worker Program (SWP).

In September 2013, a design mission was undertaken to develop a new phase of the LMI with a focus on improving the capacity of participating governments to recruit, prepare and manage workers for the SWP and to assess new options for capacity development and delivery. Any capacity building assistance would continue to focus on Pacific island governments as managers of the recruitment process.

The new LMI aims to improve the capacity of participating governments to manage aspects of the SWP. There are nine participating countries in the SWP – Solomon Islands, Vanuatu, Papua New Guinea, Kiribati, Tuvalu, Nauru, Samoa, Tonga and Timor-Leste.

The overall goal of the LMI is to address poverty through increasing incomes, improving human capital and maximising the use of earnings from labour mobility for women and men in the region. At the conclusion of the LMI, there are expected to be four primary outcomes:

  • Increased numbers of workers from participating countries take up seasonal work opportunities
  • Communities benefiting from the effective use of remittances earned through labour mobility
  • Women and men participating in the seasonal worker program have increased employability
  • Increased partner government capacity to manage international labour

The Capacity Building Adviser will have responsibility for designing and supporting a program of capacity building assistance to participating government agencies and other stakeholders, ensuring all services are delivered to best-practice standards, in accordance with the requirements and terms of the contract, and for managing the day-to-day activities of other technical advisers as appropriate.

Mandatory competencies and experience

  • Extensive experience working in developing countries.
  • Proven capacity to build and maintain effective relationships with senior personnel in government and donor agencies.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of contemporary human resource development strategies, planning and implementation, and the conduct and analysis of training needs assessments/analysis.
  • Ability to design and deliver training courses, development of culturally relevant materials and evaluate the effectiveness of training and capacity building.
  • Proven ability to deliver a suite of development activities in a developing country.
  • An understanding of the social, cultural, political and institutional factors affecting development in the Pacific and Timor-Leste
  • Strong analytical skills, strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills in English.

Desirable competencies and experience

  • Tertiary qualification in a relevant field.
  • Experience in the education, training and human development sectors in the Pacific region.

The Capacity Building Adviser may have up to 34 months of inputs over the years of the LMI, with the first 28 months being full time from the Services Order start date, with 6 months allocated across the final 12 months (in the event that the Option to Extend was enacted).

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting LMI/CBA in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

item.title: Team Leader/Senior Technical Adviser, Labour Mobility Initiative
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Since 2009 Australia has funded Pacific island governments under the Labour Mobility Initiative (LMI) to recruit, prepare and manage workers for job placements in the Pilot Seasonal Worker Pilot Scheme (PSWPS) and then the Seasonal Worker Program (SWP).

In September 2013, a design mission was undertaken to develop a new phase of the LMI with a focus on improving the capacity of participating governments to recruit, prepare and manage workers for the SWP and to assess new options for capacity development and delivery. Any capacity building assistance would continue to focus on Pacific island governments as managers of the recruitment process.

The new LMI aims to improve the capacity of participating governments to manage aspects of the SWP. There are nine participating countries in the SWP – Solomon Islands, Vanuatu, Papua New Guinea, Kiribati, Tuvalu, Nauru, Samoa, Tonga and Timor-Leste.

The overall goal of the LMI is to address poverty through increasing incomes, improving human capital and maximising the use of earnings from labour mobility for women and men in the region. At the conclusion of the LMI, there are expected to be four primary outcomes:

  • Increased numbers of workers from participating countries take up seasonal work opportunities
  • Communities benefiting from the effective use of remittances earned through labour mobility
  • Women and men participating in the seasonal worker program have increased employability
  • Increased partner government capacity to manage international labour

The Team Leader will have overall responsibility for ensuring all aspects of the Labour Mobility Initiative are delivered to best-practice standards, in accordance with the requirements and terms of the contract, and for managing the day-to-day activities of other program staff and technical advisers.

Mandatory competencies and experience:

  • Extensive experience working in developing countries.
  • Proven capacity to build and maintain effective relationships with senior personnel in government and donor agencies.
  • Strong understanding of labour mobility, seasonal work and labour hire practices, as well as related policy and regulatory frameworks.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of marketing approaches, developing marketing and engagement plans, building employer relationships and understanding of the requirements of Australian employers under the Seasonal Work Program.
  • Proven ability to set up and manage a suite of development activities in a developing country.
  • Substantial experience in the application of financial management, contracting, reporting, and monitoring and evaluation systems.
  • An understanding of the social, cultural, political and institutional factors affecting development in the Pacific region and Timor-Leste.
  • Strong analytical skills, strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills in English.

Desirable competencies and experience:

  • Tertiary qualification in a relevant field.
  • Experience in the labour hire industry or policy environment, especially in relation to the sectors associated with seasonal work in Australia.
  • Experience with Australian aid program processes and procedures.

The Team leader may have up to 34 months of inputs over the years of the LMI, with the first 28 months being full time from the Services Order start date, with 6 months allocated across the final 12 months (in the event that the Option to Extend was enacted).

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com with LMI/TL in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

item.title: Competitiveness and Innovation Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The global objective of the ex-ante evaluation is to improve the performance of the EU financial assistance and support decision-making for strategies and assistance programmes formulation. The focus is on enhancing the relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, impact, sustainability and accountability of the EU Pre-accession assistance by means of studies and evaluations of policies and projects financed from any of the instruments whose implementation is delegated to the Directorate General of DG Enlargement.

Project location: Podgorica (Montenegro), with missions to other regions of Montenegro. Project results to be presented in Brussels

Expert 4: Competitiveness and Innovation Expert

The required minimum (unless explicitly specified otherwise) qualifications of the expert proposed are:

  • University Degree up to Master’s degree or equivalent in social sciences and/or economy and related fields (or professional experience of minimum 15 years relevant to the assignment for senior expert).
  • The general expertise, whether it be academic or gained in the field, must cover all the relevant issues covered by the Operational programme
  • Proficiency in both written and spoken English (i.e. ability to work, communicate and draw up reports in English).
  • High computer literacy

The required minimum (unless explicitly specified otherwise) general professional experience of the expert is:

  • Minimum 10 years of professional experience in competitiveness and private sector development
  • Proven experience with EU’s pre-accession policy and financial instruments (in at least 1 EU funded project) in the relevant sectors in Southeast European countries will be considered as an asset.

The required minimum (unless explicitly specified otherwise) specific professional experience of the expert is:

  • At least 5 years of working experience in preferably projects related to the EU assistance, implementation, preparation or analysis/evaluation of programmes funded under IPA and/or Structural Funds investment programmes;
  • At least one experience in providing technical assistance for the programming of pre-accession funds in the areas concerned in Candidate countries or Member-States.
  • Participation in at least two ex-ante evaluations of operational programmes.
  • Fluency in written and spoken local language would be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com and Francesca_giordano@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Twinning Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The general objective of this contract is to support the Israeli Ministry of Economy and the European Commission in the preparation of an institutional Twinning project within the framework of the EU-Israel Action Plan.

The specific objective of this contract is to support the Israeli Ministry of Economy in drafting a clear and concise Twinning Fiche necessary for launching an institutional Twinning. The Twinning Fiche shall be circulated simultaneously to the 28 EU Member States in an invitation to submit proposals for its joint implementation.

Senior Twinning Expert

Qualifications and skills

• Relevant University degree; • Working experience in the public service or assimilated body; • Fluent English, oral and written

General professional experience

At least 10 years working experience in public administration

Specific professional experience

• At least 5 years of direct experience in Twinning; • Proven familiarity with Twinning procedures; • Experience of working in third countries, ideally under ENPI.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Agnese_Ortolani@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Environment and Biology Expert (Category I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Expert 2 is expected to contribute the implementation of all of the related modules and the preparation of both training materials and Training Evaluation Report in the context of related chapter/s.

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master’s degree in Biology, Ecology, Chemistry or other Natural Sciences related to assignment. In the absence of the degree required, at least 17 years of professional experience in the related areas is requested.
  • Good command of both written and spoken English.
  • General professional experience
  • At least 12 years of experience in the sector(s) related to the Lot.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 3 years of experience in technical and/or scientific fields required for the implementation of the Water Framework Directive and/or Habitat Directive and/or other related Directives.
  • At least 2 river basin management plans experience in terms of setting of environmental objectives and/or setting, design and upgrade of biological monitoring programme and/or execution and assessment of biological monitoring.
  • Experience in development of measures for water pollution reduction and/or improving ecological status, and/or river basin characterisation/analysis will be an asset.
  • Experience in projects related to Integrated Water Resources Management will be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Agnese_Ortolani@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
